image.altText: A portrait of woman in a large room.

props.synopsis: Dr Anita Hutchison is supporting a pilot program that will train GPs to recognise the signs of domestic violence and child sexual abuse.

title.children: Anita says she was asked 'can't you just forgive him?' as she tried to flee domestic violence. She wants that to change

image.altText: A group of trees in a forest.

props.synopsis: The Liberals have released their housing policy ahead of next month's ACT election, with plans for a large development on the eastern edge of the territory.

title.children: Kowen Forest to be developed for housing as part of Canberra Liberals election promise

image.altText: Law Courts of the Australian Capital Territory

props.synopsis: Former army officer cadet Jake Sullivan is on trial for six charges including rape, committing an act of indecency and assault.

title.children: 'I never forced her': Former army cadet denies raping woman

image.altText: A black cat lies down on a towl with a cone around its neck.

props.synopsis: The RSPCA's ACT branch issues an appeal for information after multiple reported cases of animal cruelty in Canberra's north.

title.children: 'Incredibly cruel': Cats discovered with bound testicles in Canberra's north

image.altText: A portrait of a doctor wearing a stethoscope around her neck, seated next to a desk.

props.synopsis: Junior doctors in Canberra worried that unpaid overtime was putting themselves and their patients at risk. They have now reached a settlement with the ACT government.

title.children: Canberra junior doctors given $31.5 million after suing over unpaid overtime

image.altText: A woman with short grey hair stands at a lectern looking angry and hurt.

props.synopsis: When Harriet Spring publicly admitted she'd lost a $1.6 million inheritance to scammers, she had low expectations for both financial compensation and criminal consequences, but over the past week there's been progress on both fronts.

title.children: Woman who lost $1.6 million to scammers campaigns for change as seven people allegedly involved are arrested

image.altText: Autumn leaves on trees and path next to Lake Tuggeranong.

props.synopsis: The ACT Greens have committed to a range of measures to combat climate change, including establishing a Chief Heat Officer, planting more trees, and bringing back Canberra's iconic bus shelters, if elected in October.

title.children: ACT Greens say they will create Chief Heat Officer if elected in October

image.altText: A man is arrested by officers

props.synopsis: A major criminal network alleged to have sold $1.8 billion of cocaine has been dismantled in a series of police raids.

title.children: Police dismantle Sydney crime network they allege sold $1.8b worth of cocaine in four months

image.altText: A close up of a grey-headed flying fox hanging upside down in a tree.

props.synopsis: A live-streaming camera is offering insights into a grey-headed flying fox colony in northern NSW, aiming to change public perception that the animals are pests, and guide conservation work.

title.children: BatCam offers glimpse into secret life of 'very, very cool' threatened flying fox species

image.altText: Men in military khakis, yellow sashes and green berets stand in a row and salute.

props.synopsis: Tensions are flaring in the Middle East for a third day as Hezbollah's chief Hassan Nasrallah vowed "just punishment" on Israel for the two days of attacks targeting remote communications devices that killed 35 people.

title.children: European leaders condemn device detonations as IDF strikes Lebanese targets

image.altText: A large cloud of smoke rises from a hillside village

props.synopsis: Israeli warplanes carry out their most intense strikes on southern Lebanon in nearly a year of war, heightening the conflict between Israel and Lebanese militant group Hezbollah.

title.children: Israel unleashes heavy strikes on Lebanon as its allies urge restraint

image.altText: A composite image of Anthony Albanese and Joe Biden.

props.synopsis: US President Joe Biden will host Anthony Albanese and the other Quad leaders in his home state of Delaware, with the discussions aimed at ensuring security in the Indo-Pacific region.

title.children: China will be 'high on the agenda' during Albanese's fleeting visit to the US this weekend

image.altText: A graphic with mouse traps and logos from major banks and telcos.

props.synopsis: Scammers are destroying people's lives — a crackdown on who will cough up when things go wrong has stakeholders divided, writes Michael Atkin.

title.children: Scammers are destroying people's lives — who should cough up if there are systemic failures?

image.altText: Anthony Albanese holds Toto outside the Lodge

props.synopsis: A political stunt over housing policy meant Labor was this week reminded that while it might be in government, it doesn't have control of the Senate.

title.children: Toto's warning barks weren't heeded as Albanese's tone soured in tense interview

image.altText: A close up from behind of a woman on the phone

props.synopsis: One in six women have experienced economic abuse at the hands of their partner, according to the Australian Bureau of Statistics. For culturally and linguistically diverse women, it can be particularly difficult to access support.

title.children: Rani's husband spent thousands of dollars on sex work, then took everything. She doesn't know where to go for support

image.altText: Centrelink sign.

props.synopsis: Here is the full list of payments increasing — and by how much — from September 20.

title.children: Multiple Centrelink payments are increasing today. Here's what you need to know

image.altText: Adam Bandt in Mural Hall

props.synopsis: The Greens were accused of holding the government to ransom on housing legislation but Adam Bandt says his party won't back down.

title.children: 'Stop bulldozing': Bandt invokes Morrison as he gets tough with Labor on housing

image.altText: A man with a bulletproof vest stands by a black police truck in front of a hedge fence and a shed.

props.synopsis: Another apparent attempt to assassinate Donald Trump leads to a blame game, some troubling questions and an awful sense of deja vu in the United States.

title.children: The US election race has taken another dark turn amid heightened fears of further political violence

image.altText: A woman and her son looking out at a beach

props.synopsis: The number of "accidental" homeschooled students is increasing across Australia, and some families are reporting positive outcomes.

title.children: Australia has a growing number of 'accidental' homeschool students, and COVID is only part of the reason

image.altText: The spire of an old church, visible in the distance, through trees.

props.synopsis: Mazan was once synonymous with the best of the south of France: vineyards on one side, lavender fields to the other. Now it's at the centre of a high-profile rape trial, and prosecutors say some of the men here have a dark secret.

title.children: This tiny French town became the centre of a rape trial, and 'everybody knows at least one man involved'

image.altText: 2008-01-16T120000Z_1761576427_GM1DXBBLHZAA_RTRMADP_3_BRITAIN-DIANA

props.synopsis: Management at London's luxury Harrods department store say they're "utterly appalled" by allegations former owner Mohamed Al Fayed sexually assaulted more than 20 employees.

title.children: 'Sexual predator' former Harrods owner Mohamed Al Fayed accused of raping multiple women

image.altText: Australian aid boxes.

props.synopsis: A Papua New Guinean minister deals scathing criticisms of Australia’s aid program valued at more than $600 million this year.

title.children: 'Wastage and lack of impact': Warnings from PNG minister over $600m in Australian aid

image.altText: Champs12

props.synopsis: Greg Champion is a serious songwriter with a not-so-serious back catalogue. But with That's What I Like About Football, the lanky songwriter from Adelaide found a footy anthem that will stand the test of time.

title.children: Mike Brady, Paul Kelly, and the second Bronson — how a footy song from the 90s became an AFL icon

image.altText: A restaurant is packed with people eating food in a brightly-lit setting

props.synopsis: The South Korean cultural phenomenon shows no signs of slowing as Melbourne announces its official Koreatown.

title.children: How Australia's newest K-town reflects the growing influence of Korea's culture on our cities

image.altText: Two women look at a share price board outside the ASX in Sydney.

props.synopsis: The Australian share market is poised to open higher after stocks surged on Wall Street in the wake of interest rate cuts in the United States. Follow the day's events and insights as they happen with our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: ASX set to open higher after Wall Street rallies

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Woolworths has "no plans" to sell Big W
Myer profit slumps, sales drop due to 'challenging conditions'
Australian share market to open higher

image.altText: Noŋgirrŋa Marawili, an Indigenous Elder, sits on a mat in front of a large painting, which features pink figures.

props.synopsis: Works from the collection of the National Gallery of Victoria will tour to North America from next year, as part of The Stars We Do Not See: Australian Indigenous Art.

title.children: Largest exhibition of Indigenous art to show overseas set to open in America next year

image.altText: William Swale at court

props.synopsis: A legal expert says Victorian prosecutors could use a rare legal tactic to force Daylesford crash driver William Swale back before the courts.

title.children: Chief prosecutor could potentially challenge decision to let Daylesford pub crash driver walk free, legal expert says

image.altText: A man wearing a military uniform.

props.synopsis: Staff upheaval and frustrations with leadership are emerging inside the new government agency overseeing the $368 billion AUKUS project.

title.children: AUKUS remains on track despite frustrations and staff turnover, submarine agency boss says

image.altText: An older woman with a dark grey bob and glasses speaks into a small microphone in front of a blue screen.

props.synopsis: The big US move will certainly make the RBA's stance harder to explain to families having trouble paying their mortgage costs and living expenses.

title.children: RBA chief might need a flak jacket after Tuesday's rates decision

image.altText: For Sale signage outside a suburban house.

props.synopsis: Older Australians have the potential to ease the housing crisis by selling their larger homes, however there are a range of complex barriers to moving later in life.

title.children: Downsizing empty-nesters could help solve the housing crisis, so why don't more make the move?

image.altText: A Modular Advanced Armed Robotic System in the field.

props.synopsis: They are the stuff of 80s sci-fi blockbuster, The Terminator, but now lethal autonomous weapon systems are being used in conflict zones around the world. One woman is trying to stop them.

title.children: Autonomous weapon systems boil human beings down to data points. One woman is determined to ban their use

image.altText: A smiling man in a puffer vest stands outside a business front.

props.synopsis: Michael Veal is the only doctor in Avoca, which was without a general practice for 12 months before he arrived. But the relief may only be temporary and it's a symptom of an Australia-wide problem.

title.children: GP who saved country town from doctor drought says primary health care has 'driven off a cliff'

image.altText: A composite image of an asteroid on a starry background.

props.synopsis: A small asteroid may become a "mini-moon" of Earth's for a couple of months, according to some astronomers. But what makes something a mini-moon, and why are they so hard to spot?

title.children: An asteroid will soon be temporarily looped into Earth's orbit. But does that make it a 'moon'?

image.altText: Monique Conti jumps on Caitlin Greiser in celebration

props.synopsis: Monique Conti shows exactly why she is the reigning AFLW best and fairest winner with a sensational performance as Richmond thrashed Carlton.

title.children: Monique Conti dominates as Richmond holds Carlton to record low in AFLW clash

image.altText: A CGI lady staring down the barrel, wearing a university staff member shirt. A menu list is displayed on the right.

props.synopsis: Researchers say uses of new technology, like creating AI virtual tutors, could be the key to solving low student participation in remote areas.

title.children: Could new technology like AI virtual tutors solve low student participation in remote areas?
